> Milt,
>

$50, but I

> 
> I was probably thinking of:
> 
> Dunn, Roger [Editor]. Token Taikai. San Francisco: Northern 
California
> Japanese Sword Club, 1976. First edition. Transcripts of 11 lectures
> presented at the Token Taikai in San Francisco in 1976, plus three 
other
> papers not presented but included to augment the lecture topics. 
Includes
> papers on armor, swords, sword fittings and history by noted 
authors John
> Yumoto, Dr. Benjamin H. Hazard, Thomas Buttweiler, Dean Hartley, K. 
K.
> Chappelear, Robert Haynes and K. Torigoye.
> [This copy noted in red ink on the Introduction page as Book 
Number "27."
> Unknown how many copies were printed.] Very Good in Wraps
> 
> Which I do have two copies of @ $35, not $25. It's a bitch getting 
older ...
> 
> Craig
> 
>

Craig !!

you subscribe to the first law of the Faranghi ?
It says.......... " there is no shame in being expensive " 
the second law says........ " the stupidity of other species is not 
the fault of the Faranghis "

that 11 lectures book in hard cover for 35 beans ?  It's an excellent 
book even at twice your asking price.

By the way, I have a copy of the " meibutsu " 79  catalog with fold 
out  oshigata for sale at 50 + 5.00 shipping.   As you can deduce, i 
do follow the laws of the Faranghis when selling .........  =)

milt
